transportAdvice: New Delhi has an extensive metro network that connects most major tourist and commercial areas, making it a practical and affordable way to get around; buses also cover the wider city but can be crowded and harder to navigate for visitors. Taxis and auto-rickshaws are widely available throughout the city, though walking long distances is generally impractical due to traffic, heat, and uneven pavements.

weather.description: Cool and dry winter days with chilly nights and occasional morning fog that can disrupt travel.
Pleasantly mild with warming days and clear skies, one of the more comfortable months to visit.
Temperatures rise noticeably and conditions remain dry, making sightseeing comfortable but increasingly warm.

Monsoon continues with persistent rain and muggy conditions; waterlogging is common across the city.
Rains begin to ease but humidity remains high; conditions gradually become more bearable toward month's end.
Post-monsoon cooling brings pleasant days and comfortable evenings, making this an excellent time to visit.
Cool and dry with clear skies, though air quality can deteriorate significantly due to seasonal smog and crop burning.
Cold winter nights and mild days with dense fog possible, especially in the second half of the month.
